# Heavy Vehicle Driver Conduct Record

The conduct record contains all the events associated with driving a heavy vehicle.

New versions of the _Conduct Review Policy for Heavy Vehicle Owners and Operators_ and the _Conduct Review Policy for Heavy Vehicle Drivers_ came into force on **February 17, 2023**. The Excellence Program for Heavy Vehicle Drivers was also abolished on that date. Please refer to the page regarding the [revisions that have been made to the conduct review policies for heavy vehicle owners, operators and drivers](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/transportation-goods/conduct-review-policies) for more information.

The information found in the conduct record of drivers of heavy vehicles is provided in 2 documents:

- **Monitoring of Heavy Vehicle Driver Conduct**
- **Information Concerning the Driver's Record**

## _Monitoring of Heavy Vehicle Driver Conduct_ document

This document presents a heavy vehicle driver's conduct record by conduct area, and specifies the number of points that must not be reached (called the “threshold value”) for each conduct area, in accordance with the [Conduct Review Policy for Heavy Vehicle Drivers⁠ ⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/publications/conduct-review-policy-hvd.pdf ""). It includes any events related to driving heavy vehicles registered in Québec that are operated in Canada.

The document provides details of **any events related to the actions of a heavy vehicle driver while that person was on duty**, regardless of which operator was using that driver's services when the events occurred.

The document provides information about the following:

- any critical events triggering an immediate referral of the driver's record to the [Commission des transports du Québec⁠ ⁠](https://www.ctq.gouv.qc.ca/english/) (CTQ)
- any critical alcohol- or drug-related driving offences
- any accidents in which the driver was involved, and the number of points associated with each accident
- any other offences and any out-of-service orders, as well as the associated number of points
- the total number of points accumulated by the driver in each conduct area
- any prohibition from driving a heavy vehicle ordered by the [CTQ⁠ ⁠](https://www.ctq.gouv.qc.ca/english/)

Events remain in the conduct record for 2 years, except for events related to alcohol- or drug-related driving offences, which remain in the record for 10 years.

### Obtaining a copy of the _Monitoring of Heavy Vehicle Driver Conduct_ document

A copy of your conduct record is provided:

- upon request (online, in person, by email, by phone or by mail)
- as part of an intervention on our part

### How to request a conduct record

#### Online

Heavy vehicle drivers can now obtain a copy of their conduct record via [SAAQclic⁠ ⁠](https://saaqclic.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/saaqstorefront/en/login).

To access their conduct record, heavy vehicle drivers must select “My Driving Record” in the left menu, and then “Obtaining Information Regarding My Driving.”

We highly recommend that heavy vehicle drivers download an updated copy of their conduct record, even if they obtained a copy relatively recently (prior to May 8), because a number of adjustments have been made in recent weeks.

Conduct records are updated whenever adjustments are made, with the updated version ready for download the following day. Conduct records are also automatically updated every 7 days.

For more information, please refer to the latest edition of _Le Relayeur_ (in French only): [Disponibilité des états de dossier des PEVL et des suivis de comportement des CVL.](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/transport-biens/le-relayeur/disponibilite-etats-dossier-pevl-suivis-comportement-cvl)

If you are unable to use our online services but would like to request a copy of your conduct record or have any questions, you can contact us:

- in person: at any of our service centres
- by email: [courrier@saaq.gouv.qc.ca This link opens your default email software.](mailto:courrier@saaq.gouv.qc.ca "")
- by phone: 1-800-554-4814, from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. on Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday, and from 9:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. on Wednesday
- by mail:

Direction des politiques, de la performance et des relations avec le milieu

Société de l'assurance automobile du Québec

333, boul. Jean-Lesage, E-4-32

Case postale 19600, succursale Terminus

Québec (Québec)  G1K 8J6

**For reasons of security and the protection of personal information…**

You will receive a copy of the document **by mail** at the address that appears in your record, within 5 to 10 business days after we receive your request.

### Application to have a conduct record adjusted

Applications to have a conduct record adjusted must be faxed to 418 643 1896 or mailed to the address provided above. Note that you must now include with your application the form entitled Application to Have a [Conduct Record Adjusted – Heavy Vehicle Owners, Operators and Drivers⁠ ⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/formulaires/demande-regularisation-dossier-pecvl.pdf "").

## _Information Concerning the Driver's Record_ document

The _Information Concerning the Driver's Record_ document provides a general overview of a driver's record (all types of vehicles combined).

It includes a section that summarizes any events related to driving a heavy vehicle registered in Québec.

If any events appear in this section, the driver can request a copy of the _Monitoring of Heavy Vehicle Driver Conduct_ document for more details.

### To obtain your own Driving Record

You can file a request in any of the following ways to receive a copy of the _Information Concerning the Driver's Record_ document.

### To obtain another person's driving record (insurer, employer, vehicle fleet owner, etc.)

If you wish to obtain a copy of another person's driving record, you must first obtain that person's authorization.

#### Procedure

1. Fill out the appropriate form:
   - [Authorization for the Disclosure of a Driving Record by the Société de l'assurance automobile du Québec (PDF, 118.5 KB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/formulaires/driver-disclosure-form.pdf)
   - [Authorization for the Disclosure of a Driving Record by the Société de l'assurance automobile du Québec – With Intermediary (PDF, 132.6 KB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/formulaires/driver-disclosure-intermediary-form.pdf)
2. Fill out the [Driving Record Search (PDF, 131.0 KB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/formulaires/driving-record-form.pdf) form
3. Mail the forms, along with a cheque or money order, to:

    Division de la diffusion (act. 850)

    Société de l'assurance automobile du Québec

    Case postale 19600, succursale Terminus

    Québec (Québec)  G1K 8J6

For more information, go to our [Driving Record Request](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/drivers-licences/driving-record-request) page.

Last update: September 30, 2025
